The paragraph is discussing HPMA copolymers and the binding of DOX (Doxorubicin) to these copolymers via peptide linkages. The peptide linkages are further described as non-biodegradable (Gly-Gly) or degradable by lysosomal proteinases (Gly-Phe-Leu-Gly). Therefore, no specific diseases are mentioned in the paragraph.

Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In these HPMA copolymers , DOX was covalently bound via peptide linkages that were either non - biodegradable ( Gly - Gly ) or degradable by lysosomal proteinases ( Gly - Phe - Leu - Gly ) .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| DOX |
| Gly |
| Phe |
| Leu |

In the given paragraph, "DOX" is the specific chemical entity mentioned. The other entities "Gly", "Phe", and "Leu" are common amino acids. Hence, they are also valid chemical entities in this context.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Chemical" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| DOX |
| Gly-Gly |
| Gly-Phe-Leu-Gly |

In the given paragraph, "DOX" is the specific chemical entity mentioned. "Gly-Gly" and "Gly-Phe-Leu-Gly" are peptide linkages, but they can be considered as chemical entities since they are formed by the covalent bonding of specific amino acids (Glycine, in this case). Therefore, they are valid chemical entities in this context.
